title: Michael Owen slams Manchester United first half performance as Louis van Gaal watches on
text:
Michael Owen has laid into Manchester United after an underwhelming first half display in the Europa League as they took on AZ Alkmaar,

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side failed to register a shot on target in their Europa League outing in the Netherlands, with former United boss Louis van Gaal watching on from the stands as his two old clubs went head to head.

And outspoken pundit Owen, assuming his role as BT Sport analysis, said that little has changed in style of play at the club since the 68-year-old left Old Trafford in 2016.

Michael Owen has slammed Manchester United's first half performance against AZ Alkmaar

He said: 'I think Manchester United have been what they are. We can sit and say it’s been disappointing but it’s not.

'Louis van Gaal has been in the stands and it reminds me of one of his teams. Loads of possession but no cutting edge.

'United have been what United are away from home. If you had offered four points from two games they would have taken it.

Solskjaer's side are looking to make it two wins from their first two Europa League games as the second half gets underway.
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side failed to register a shot on target in their Europa League outing, with former United boss Louis van Gaal watching his former clubs from the stands.
